paragraphs.text: I will not march with you, I’ve already marched.
paragraphs.name: 3c8c
eefc
paragraphs.text: I will remember you saying Nate Silver told you marching was unnecessary.
Me too.
paragraphs.name: 3e60

paragraphs.text: And now we STAND… as others march.
paragraphs.name: 2bf2

paragraphs.text: You know what I’m talking about. You’ve earned it.

content.subtitle: And now we STAND… as others march.

5db0fd54d94e.title: GOSH, DO I RESONATE with I’ve already marched. Let me tell you?

paragraphs.text: GOSH, DO I RESONATE with I’ve already marched. Let me tell you?

I marched in state after state for passage of the Equal Rights Amendment to the US Constitution that would make sex discrimination suffered widely by us American females, a Violation of that Constitution.
paragraphs.name: 94e1

e43c6943ff9b.title: Danielle, I get what you are saying.

paragraphs.text: Danielle, I get what you are saying. I could not march because this is my busiest work time and I am logging in 70+ hours a week, but even if I could have, I don’t know that I would have marched. I love the solidarity. I love the masses all over the world coming together for a cause, but I truly wonder what good it will do. So many of those who…

virtuals.subtitle: I was a Bernie person myself and I am, honestly, not a huge Clinton fan, but I didn’t need to be. I saw that she was the answer to one of…

content.subtitle: I was a Bernie person myself and I am, honestly, not a huge Clinton fan, but I didn’t need to be. I saw that she was the answer to one of…

5468ede59a0f.title: I don’t agree with your politics, but I applaud you for writing this.

paragraphs.text: I don’t agree with your politics, but I applaud you for writing this. It took courage. You are right to be bothered by how many people will show up for the collective tantrum, but don’t want to actually do the real work.
paragraphs.name: 955b

db2c2f44c00a.title: Sorry that you feel so let down.

paragraphs.text: Sorry that you feel so let down. It does suck when sometimes it’s like you’re shouting into a wind tunnel and then someone comes along saying essentially the same thing, but they get a megaphone. I just hope you also remember that there were those who stood with you when your voices were small. I hope you know that they are still there now, ready to…
paragraphs.name: 41f0

paragraphs.text: Thanks for your service, truly.
paragraphs.name: 8d81

paragraphs.text: Thank you for this. My heart goes out to you for all the mean comments people are posting. I think it’s mostly that they just don’t understand exactly what you’re saying. Or guilt.
As a black woman who has been having the EXACT SAME conversation (literally, same convo, same words) with white women (mostly women) about the…
paragraphs.name: 5dac

e2ed0d3fd63f.title: I’m almost 66yrs old and have marched, knocked on doors, mailed flyers, contributed time, money and…

paragraphs.text: I’m almost 66yrs old and have marched, knocked on doors, mailed flyers, contributed time, money and effort to a number of candidates and issues I’ve been passionate about over the years. We won some, we lost some, we inched forward, never fast enough, never far enough. And yes, it was always disappointing & frustrating to see the light come on in the…
paragraphs.name: aa64

8149070fe5a1.title: A great many comments here criticize your anger.

paragraphs.text: A great many comments here criticize your anger. I am saddened by your post, but I will not criticize it. You are spot on when you criticize the many people who did not vote. Ms. Clinton should have won this election, and was prevented from winning by a perfect storm of factors, one of which was the failure of people to actually go out and vote.
paragraphs.name: e4cb

virtuals.subtitle: I have particular contempt for the Sanders voters who refused to heed Mr. Sanders himself and refused to vote for Ms. Clinton. Their…

content.subtitle: I have particular contempt for the Sanders voters who refused to heed Mr. Sanders himself and refused to vote for Ms. Clinton. Their…

4dfba350b4a.title: Respect your opinion and thank you for your work on the campaign.

paragraphs.text: Respect your opinion and thank you for your work on the campaign. But the march started long before HRC decided to run for President (the first time) and should continue long after we kick Trump out. Try a little perspective.
paragraphs.name: 7b55

paragraphs.text: How sanctimonious. I met several people at the women’s marches yesterday who had also already marched… in the civil rights movement of the 60s, in ACT UP, in the climate change march, in a dozen other causes. They too, were derided by their so-called allies. But they never thought that staying home and yelling I told you so made them a better person.
paragraphs.name: fdc1

virtuals.subtitle: March or don’t march, just reconsider your smug tone.

content.subtitle: March or don’t march, just reconsider your smug tone.

ca54d3cf2539.title: How do you think I felt on Election Day after all the work I put in?

paragraphs.text: How do you think I felt on Election Day after all the work I put in? Do you really think you were alone out there working for our party’s candidate? Did you not look to your left or to your right or maybe behind you?
paragraphs.name: 58bb

paragraphs.text: Hillary and the DNC cheated. You said nothing. No one cares what you or the other HRC groupies say until you acknowledge that crime that put us here. Sorry.
paragraphs.name: 9f03

b595a9331520.title: I mostly agree with you, but this is weird, considering Nate Silver was almost alone in saying…

paragraphs.text: I mostly agree with you, but this is weird, considering Nate Silver was almost alone in saying marching was very much necessary, and got endless flack for saying Trump had a real chance when all pundits thought otherwise.
paragraphs.name: e443

a2f33a561c18.title: Exactly. What were many of these women thinking about when they painted HRC as the devil.

paragraphs.text: Exactly. What were many of these women thinking about when they painted HRC as the devil. The world could be a funny place a lot of times.
paragraphs.name: 9a0f

paragraphs.text: I’ve Already Marched
paragraphs.name: 7a7a

paragraphs.text: I will not march.
paragraphs.name: 678e

6b1abdd27fa9.title: I understand your frustration (beautifully put by the way).

paragraphs.text: I understand your frustration (beautifully put by the way). That people have a wake-up call when it’s too late is enraging. The day after Brexit the UK would have voted against it, and yet their prime minister is going for it, and not with half measures… Take more time to mourn and regroup, but your co-citizens will definitely need all this energy of yours.
paragraphs.name: 8cdb

a370a32f208.title: I don’t believe bashing people who want to get involved is the best way to create a resistance.

paragraphs.text: I don’t believe bashing people who want to get involved is the best way to create a resistance. This article screams division in a time where unity is what we desperately need. (Stronger together.)
paragraphs.name: ac13

paragraphs.text: As someone whom you admire once said “Never stop believing that fighting for what’s right is worth it” -Hillary Clinton.
paragraphs.name: d526

virtuals.subtitle: As someone whom you admire once said “Never stop believing that fighting for what’s right is worth it” -Hillary Clinton.

content.subtitle: As someone whom you admire once said “Never stop believing that fighting for what’s right is worth it” -Hillary Clinton.

paragraphs.text: Yes, you have. Hand off the baton. Rest now, your warrior spirit will be needed, when this movement loses its luster and another one takes it place. YOU will remind us again. Thank you.
paragraphs.name: df3a

ccf9809c3a7f.title: Kathryn Alexander, I don’t think she’s whining at all.

paragraphs.text: Kathryn Alexander, I don’t think she’s whining at all. You should be able to march on your own free will at your time. March when you feel the right to march, not for the sake of being a sheep. Whether you marched or not today, Danielle has the right to free speech on an platform like Medium just as you do to march today.
paragraphs.name: 3e46

virtuals.subtitle: PS This isn’t a personal attack at you in any way. I hope you don’t take it personal.

content.subtitle: PS This isn’t a personal attack at you in any way. I hope you don’t take it personal.

paragraphs.text: Wow how annoying. I have been politically active since high school, demonstrating and taking part in political action against Apartheid, Reagan, the Gulf War, and really too many causes to mention. You are young, maybe it is your turn. But here I am in Washington, not feeling a bit self-righteous, as that would be total bullshit, like this article.
paragraphs.name: 2d36

3c0878ce2224.title: You campaigned for Hillary and others didn’t, so what?

paragraphs.text: You campaigned for Hillary and others didn’t, so what? Do you want credit because you spend your time defending what you believed in? Millions of people do it everyday and most of them get nothing in return.
paragraphs.name: f308

paragraphs.text: As a black woman I get this notion. Where were you when I needed you to act. However the truth is not black and white. MILLIONS of people of women voted for HRC. Millions. Thousands of white women have been involved in activism for black folks, LGBTQ, women’s rights for decades. Look at the pictures from Kings marches. There are white folks there. At…

dac760c356ff.title: Pretty ironic that you complain about people’s excuses for not showing up then declare that you…

paragraphs.text: Pretty ironic that you complain about people’s excuses for not showing up then declare that you yourself aren’t showing up. And the people I know who are marching all donated huge amounts of time and effort to the campaign. Unlike you they are still fighting.
